title: Chili Mac Recipe
description: This chili mac starts with a quick and easy beef chili made on the stove mixed with pasta and cheese, then baked in the oven for a comforting meal.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Everyday Cooking Chili Mac 4.6 (185) 138 Reviews 56 Photos This chili mac adds a little spice to a comfort food favorite by sprinkling on Sargento Shredded Reduced Fat 4 Cheese Mexican Cheese. Olé! Submitted by Sargento Updated on September 19, 2023 Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen The Allrecipes Test Kitchen staff are a team of culinary pros who make and vet recipes using only equipment you'd find in a home kitchen. Staff credentials vary but include training at the Culinary Institute of America; kitchen stints in fine dining restaurants; and countless hours in the test kitchen itself. Meet the Allrecipes Test Kitchen Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 56 56 56 56 Prep Time: 20 mins Cook Time: 35 mins Total Time: 55 mins Servings: 6 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 6 servings 1 pound ground beef or turkey 1 medium onion, chopped 1 green bell pepper, chopped 1 (14.5 ounce) can Mexican or chili-style stewed tomatoes, undrained ½ cup water 1 (1.25 ounce) package taco seasoning mix 2 cups elbow macaroni or small shells, cooked and drained 2 cups Sargento ® Shredded Reduced Fat 4 Cheese Mexican Cheese, divided Directions Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Cook ground beef, onion, and bell pepper in a large skillet over medium heat until beef is crumbly and no longer pink, about 5 minutes; pour off drippings. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Add tomatoes, water, and taco seasoning; simmer, stirring occasionally, for 5 minutes. Remove from heat. Stir cooked pasta into meat mixture until combined. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Spoon 3 cups meat mixture into an 11x7-inch baking dish. Sprinkle with 1 cup cheese; top with remaining meat mixture. Cover with aluminum foil. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Bake in the preheated oven for 30 minutes. Remove foil; sprinkle with remaining cheese. Continue baking until cheese is melted, about 5 minutes. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios I Made It Print 465 home cooks made it! Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Chili Mac 01 of 56 Photo by  Dotdash Meredith Food Studios 02 of 56 Photo by  Phantom 03/24/2023 03 of 56 Photo by  sandrad14967 02/07/2022 Oh how I love this simple easy recipe. It is so delicious and my family loves it. I did add a can of tomato sauce and a few more spices. I also used ground turkey instead of Ground meat. 04 of 56 Photo by  Naomi 08/11/2021 05 of 56 Photo by  Michael Ferguson 04/17/2021 06 of 56 Photo by  Keyth Sokol 02/08/2021 07 of 56 Photo by  hockeymom 01/11/2021 We loved the finish product....changed a little bit, added red peppers instead of green, added black beans, and of course avocados and sour cream on the top! name: Sargento

Dotdash Meredith Food Studios;Add tomatoes, water, and taco seasoning; simmer, stirring occasionally, for 5 minutes. Remove from heat. Stir cooked pasta into meat mixture until combined. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios;Spoon 3 cups meat mixture into an 11x7-inch baking dish. Sprinkle with 1 cup cheese; top with remaining meat mixture. Cover with aluminum foil. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios;Bake in the preheated oven for 30 minutes. Remove foil; sprinkle with remaining cheese. Continue baking until cheese is melted, about 5 minutes.
